summary: The Safe Schools Improvement Act aims to address and prevent bullying and harassment in public elementary and secondary schools. It amends Title IV of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to require states to establish anti-bullying policies. These policies must prohibit conduct that limits a student's ability to participate in school activities or creates a hostile environment, including harassment based on various protected characteristics. The bill also mandates data collection on bullying incidents, state reports to the Secretary, and a biennial evaluation. The bill has specific rules about federal and state laws, free speech and expression. The bill is cited as the Safe Schools Improvement Act.
